The next'Barnstormer's production, Boy Meets
Girl by Bella and Samuel Spewack, will be given
the 21st and 22nd of this month.
This play was selected along with "The Petrified Forest" at the beginning of the year.
Unlike The Petrified Forest, Boy Meets Girl is
a light comedy; 'a satire on Hollywood and Hollywood's productions. It differs from the majority of
satires, the humor being written 'into the lines.
This technique makes the satire more or less blunt
contributing a great deal to the comedy of the play
and "makes it..one of the best comedies of recent
years."

principals in the first Barnstormer production, the

If elected president of the Student Council these will be my objectives: (1) Expanded parking
facilities on campus; (2) Active
cooperation with the Assembly'.
Committee in order that next
year's assemblies be frequent, well
attended and appropriate to student interest; (3) Continued
Council backing of the new Used
Book Store to be set up this
epring; (4) (loser coordination
with the Student Activities Committee in order that elected student representatives, as well as
administrative appointees, exert
control over the purse, strings of
Hopkins extra-curricular activities; (5) Above all, I shall endeavor to create an active, respected Student Council out of an
organization which at tithes has
been satisfied with the role of a
do-nothing debating society. I
hope that in this way, the Council will truly become the chief link
between the student body and the
administration, and the effective
guardian of the Hopkins Honor
System.
—Les Groin

Many schools look on student
publications, and rightly, as their
best advertising medium. The
Hopkins has often neglected its
student voice in print. At a school
which has a fairly extensive writing dePartment compared with the
size of the entire university, it is
strange that student publications
should be tolerated rather than
Patronized by school officials.
I do not speak for the editors
of the Review, Jaywalker, or
News-Letter, but rather I speak
personal observation of
from
faults in the publication system
at the Hopkins:
Crimson Combines
An example of what can be done
with a student publication is the
excellent Harvard Crimson. It
combines the functions of a publicity sheet for the school and a
quality medium for the student
Yoke.
At the) Hopkins, no course
credits are given to editors of publications for their hours of work
in practical journalism, subsidies
to publications are small, and of
course staff members receive no
remuneration. Many large universillies are liberal in granting one
or' more of these helps to student
publication work.

Ambassador Opens
His Excellency, M.A.H. Ispihani, ambassador from Pakistan to
the United States, will officially
open the third annuals drive of the
World Student Service Fund here
in an address to the Hopkins
student body, next Friday at 10
A.M. in Levering Great Hall.
The ambassador will express The
appreciation of the college students of Pakistan tor the $500 aid
which was given them as a result
of the Hopkins drive last year.
The conditions of his country,
the general economic ,problems,
and the life of the college man in
Pakistan will also be discussed by
the diplomat.

Native of M 1ras
Ispihani was orn in Madras in
he year 190 and was educated
at St. John's College, Cambridge
(England) where he received the
degrees of MA and LLB.
Returning to the Indo-Pakistan
sub-continent in 1925, he entered
the family business, one of the
oldest established import-export
•louses in the East.
+ From 1945-47 he was president
of the Muslim Chamber of Corn-

merce, Calcutta and senior vicepresident of the Muslim Industrial
and Commercial Federation.
First Ambassador
He enjoys the privilege of being
Pakistan's first ambassador and
also his country's first ambassidor
to the United States. Before his
appointment, he visited America
to present "The Vase of Muslim
India" at the Herald Tribune
Forum in 1946.
He has also conducted goodwill
tours of the South American
countries.
When Mr. Isphani was Kgiiing
for the Chamber of Commerce
seat at the last elections for the
Bengal Legislative Assembly in
BritiSh India in 1945, no votes
were recorded in favor of his opponent, including his own, something probably unique in elections
under a democratic system.
Moos To Introduce
Ispihani -will be introduced by
Dr. Malcolm C. Moos of the department of political science. Trophy
awards for fraternity and independent league champs will also
be presented then.

chloroprene rubber produced by Du Pont research—
has long outpointed natural rubber
on manycounts.Becauseofits greater
resistance to chemicals, flame, heat,
sunlight, weathering, oxidation, oils,
grease and abrasion,it is widely used
in such products as industrial hose,
conveyor and transmissicin belts, insulated wire and cable,hospitalsheeting, gloves and automotive parts.
Until,recently, however, certain
naturalrubber compositionscouldn't
be beaten when it came to "permanent set" characteristics. Released
from the pressure of prolonged deformatiou,they returned more nearly
to their original shape.
This recovery factor is important
to some manufacturers, particularly
the people who make gaskets, seals,
NEOPRENE—the

diaphragms,sheet packing,soft rolls
and vibration-dampening devices.
NEW PRODUCT NEEDED

Much as they wanted to use neoprene because of its other superiorities, they often needed more resistance to permanent deformation than
it afforded.So they used natural rubber, but were never quite satisfied
with the way it resisted deterioration in severe service.
Du Pont scientists went to work
to solve the problem.Skilled research
chemists, physicists, engineers and
others pooled their efforts. The result was a new polymer named Neoprene Type W.
NEOPRENE TYPE W INTRODUCED

Chemically, the new neoprene is
quite similar to previous types. But

Jackson Laboratory, Deepavaler, N. J., one o/
Dv Pont's laboratories which participated in the
sievetopmenf of Neoprene Typo W.

its molecular structure has been
changed so that the mechanical properties of its compositions are more
nearly like those of rubber. With
Neoprene Type W, it is possible to
prod ucevi bration-dam peningdevices
that are not only highly resistant to
oils, heat, grease and sunlight, but
recover better than rubber from prolonged pressure.
Neoprene Type W also provides
the basis for compositions that have
a low modulus ofelasticity—are easy
to stretch. More attractive colors are
Asible. Soon it may appear in such
articles as swim caps, where bright
colors and head comfort are important. The brighter-colored compositions should also appeal to makers
of appliance corcls, coasters, sink
mats,stove mats and toys.
In developing the uses ofNeoprene
Type W, Du Pont is working with
hundreds of manufacturers and distributors. Once again a "partnership"of big and small businesses will
cooperate to give Americans the
benefits of an advance ill science.

A second-string All-American
choice in his first season of varsity
lacrosse, attacknian Byron Forbush is one of two non-Seniors to
' crack a veteran Jay -lineup in the
quest for a fourth consecutive intercollegiate stick crown (goalie
Joe Sollers the other).
Forbush hit for two goals
against Loyola in the season's
opener two weeks ago and is apparently on his way to another
banner year. Last Spring the former all-Mrayland selection from
Friends School placed third in
Blue Jay scoring with 18 goals,
teaming with Corky Shepherd and
Reds Wolman to make up the nation's finest attack unit.

Forbush Versatile
A versatile student since his
Friends days, when he served as
President of his class for two
years and Vice-President of Student Council, in addition to playleg four years of ,football, basketball, and lacrosse. Forbush has
had equally as full a collegiate
career.
For two years Forbush, a History Major, combined his athletics
with a B scholastic average, and
then last Spring he went into the
political field, gaining the Junior
class presidency and putting the
class on its financial feet. He is
also a member of Alpha Delta Phi
fraternity.

sports thrills since coming to

The next'Barnstormer's production, Boy Meets
Girl by Bella and Samuel Spewack, will be given
the 21st and 22nd of this month.
This play was selected along with "The Petrified Forest" at the beginning of the year.
Unlike The Petrified Forest, Boy Meets Girl is
a light comedy; 'a satire on Hollywood and Hollywood's productions. It differs from the majority of
satires, the humor being written 'into the lines.
This technique makes the satire more or less blunt
contributing a great deal to the comedy of the play
and "makes it..one of the best comedies of recent
years."

Lorca, who, in addition to his other talents,
was adept. at painting and music, made his first
and only visit to the United States in 1929,
amidst this country's era of the Charleston and

by the American way of life. American women
fascinated him. Questioned as to his reactions
to „them, the poet replied that he had great
admiration for their beauty; especially:that of
their figures.

from

Ambassador Opens
His Excellency, M.A.H. Ispihani, ambassador from Pakistan to
the United States, will officially
open the third annuals drive of the
World Student Service Fund here
in an address to the Hopkins
student body, next Friday at 10
A.M. in Levering Great Hall.
The ambassador will express The
appreciation of the college students of Pakistan tor the $500 aid
which was given them as a result
of the Hopkins drive last year.
The conditions of his country,
the general economic ,problems,
and the life of the college man in
Pakistan will also be discussed by
the diplomat.

Native of M 1ras
Ispihani was orn in Madras in
he year 190 and was educated
at St. John's College, Cambridge
(England) where he received the
degrees of MA and LLB.
Returning to the Indo-Pakistan
sub-continent in 1925, he entered
the family business, one of the
oldest established import-export
•louses in the East.
+ From 1945-47 he was president
of the Muslim Chamber of Corn-

merce, Calcutta and senior vicepresident of the Muslim Industrial
and Commercial Federation.
First Ambassador
He enjoys the privilege of being
Pakistan's first ambassador and
also his country's first ambassidor
to the United States. Before his
appointment, he visited America
to present "The Vase of Muslim
India" at the Herald Tribune
Forum in 1946.
He has also conducted goodwill
tours of the South American
countries.
When Mr. Isphani was Kgiiing
for the Chamber of Commerce
seat at the last elections for the
Bengal Legislative Assembly in
BritiSh India in 1945, no votes
were recorded in favor of his opponent, including his own, something probably unique in elections
under a democratic system.
Moos To Introduce
Ispihani -will be introduced by
Dr. Malcolm C. Moos of the department of political science. Trophy
awards for fraternity and independent league champs will also
be presented then.

chloroprene rubber produced by Du Pont research—
has long outpointed natural rubber
on manycounts.Becauseofits greater
resistance to chemicals, flame, heat,
sunlight, weathering, oxidation, oils,
grease and abrasion,it is widely used
in such products as industrial hose,
conveyor and transmissicin belts, insulated wire and cable,hospitalsheeting, gloves and automotive parts.
Until,recently, however, certain
naturalrubber compositionscouldn't
be beaten when it came to "permanent set" characteristics. Released
from the pressure of prolonged deformatiou,they returned more nearly
to their original shape.
This recovery factor is important
to some manufacturers, particularly
the people who make gaskets, seals,
NEOPRENE—the

diaphragms,sheet packing,soft rolls
and vibration-dampening devices.
NEW PRODUCT NEEDED

Much as they wanted to use neoprene because of its other superiorities, they often needed more resistance to permanent deformation than
it afforded.So they used natural rubber, but were never quite satisfied
with the way it resisted deterioration in severe service.
Du Pont scientists went to work
to solve the problem.Skilled research
chemists, physicists, engineers and
others pooled their efforts. The result was a new polymer named Neoprene Type W.
NEOPRENE TYPE W INTRODUCED

Chemically, the new neoprene is
quite similar to previous types. But

Jackson Laboratory, Deepavaler, N. J., one o/
Dv Pont's laboratories which participated in the
sievetopmenf of Neoprene Typo W.

its molecular structure has been
changed so that the mechanical properties of its compositions are more
nearly like those of rubber. With
Neoprene Type W, it is possible to
prod ucevi bration-dam peningdevices
that are not only highly resistant to
oils, heat, grease and sunlight, but
recover better than rubber from prolonged pressure.
Neoprene Type W also provides
the basis for compositions that have

A second-string All-American
choice in his first season of varsity
lacrosse, attacknian Byron Forbush is one of two non-Seniors to
' crack a veteran Jay -lineup in the
quest for a fourth consecutive intercollegiate stick crown (goalie
Joe Sollers the other).
Forbush hit for two goals
against Loyola in the season's
opener two weeks ago and is apparently on his way to another
banner year. Last Spring the former all-Mrayland selection from
Friends School placed third in
Blue Jay scoring with 18 goals,
teaming with Corky Shepherd and
Reds Wolman to make up the nation's finest attack unit.

Forbush Versatile
A versatile student since his
Friends days, when he served as
President of his class for two
years and Vice-President of Student Council, in addition to playleg four years of ,football, basketball, and lacrosse. Forbush has
had equally as full a collegiate
career.
For two years Forbush, a History Major, combined his athletics
with a B scholastic average, and
then last Spring he went into the
political field, gaining the Junior
class presidency and putting the
class on its financial feet. He is
also a member of Alpha Delta Phi
fraternity.
